summary: Authorizes the reinstatement of Eric M. Jukes as an employee of the department of civil service and authorizing the village of Nassau to hire Officer Jukes in its police department.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2159

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                   January 18, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by Sen. McDONALD -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Civil Service and Pensions

       AN ACT to amend chapter 442 of the laws of 2008, relating to authorizing
         the reinstatement of Eric M. Jukes as an employee of the department of
         civil service and authorizing the village of Nassau  to  hire  Officer
         Jukes  to  fill  a  full-time competitive position with the village of
         Nassau police department, in relation to making technical  corrections
         thereto

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Chapter 442 of the laws of 2008,  relating  to  authorizing
    2  the  reinstatement  of Eric M. Jukes as an employee of the department of
    3  civil service and authorizing the village  of  Nassau  to  hire  Officer
    4  Jukes  to  fill  a  full-time  competitive  position with the village of
    5  Nassau police department, is amended to read as follows:
    6    Section 1. [Notwithstanding section 58 of the civil service  law,  the
    7  legislature  hereby  authorizes and directs the reinstatement of Officer
    8  Eric M. Jukes to the department of civil service as an employee thereof,
    9  regardless of Officer Jukes' failure  to  maintain  continual  full-time
   10  service  as a police officer, and hereby declares Officer Jukes eligible
   11  for permanent appointment in the competitive class of the civil service.
   12    S 2.] Notwithstanding section 58 of the civil service law or any other
   13  law to the contrary, the village of Nassau, in the county of Rensselaer,
   14  is hereby authorized and directed upon the approval of the village board
   15  of trustees and the police chief of the village  of  Nassau  to  appoint
   16  Eric M. Jukes, a former full-time police officer with the police depart-
   17  ment  of  the village of East Greenbush and currently a part-time police
   18  officer with the police department of the village of Nassau, to a  full-
   19  time competitive position as a police officer with the police department
   20  of such village.
   21    S [3] 2. This act shall take effect immediately.
   22    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD01508-01-1
